products.title: Luna Senape w/ Blond Horse
products.body_html:
Design

With an asymmetrical crown inspired by the crescent moon and a bold, downturned brim, this hat makes a statement as luminous as its namesake.

Material

100% Hare Fur Felt sustainably acquired

Specifications

Asymmetrical 3 3/4" crescent shaped crown. 3 1/2" downturned brim. Handmade in our atelier in NYC.

products.body_html:
Design

With an asymmetrical crown inspired by the crescent moon and a bold, downturned brim, this hat makes a statement as luminous as its namesake.

Material

100% Hare Fur Felt sustainably acquired

Specifications

Asymmetrical 3 3/4" crescent shaped crown. 3 1/2" downturned brim. Hand Painted by our master craftsman in our atelier in NYC. All our hats are exquisitely handmade, therefore they are unique and not identical. Please allow 2-4 weeks to custom make this special piece.

products.title: Gadabout Blue Gray
products.body_html:
Design

This 100% Long Haired Beaver hat offers exceptional warmth and an authentic look.

Material

100% Long Haired Beaver hat sustainably acquired

Specifications

100% Long Haired Beaver hat blue gray. The 3 ½” brim and 4” rounded crown brings a modern twist to the age-old pelted fur look.

products.title: Elafonsi
products.body_html:
Design

Hand dyed dusty rose 100% Beaver bolero with 4" crown and 3" table top brim. Dedicated to my wife, an inspiration of life...Finished of with 19th century woven band

Material

100% Western Beaver Fur Felt hand dyed and sustainably acquired. Natural dyeing minimizes the harmful effects on the surrounding environment. Our custom hats are hand dyed by using plants and vegetables base pigments.

Specifications

Hand dyed dusty rose 100% Beaver bolero 4" crown and 3" tabletop brim. Finished of with 19th century woven band. Handmade in our atelier in NYC. Please allow 2-4 weeks to custom make this special piece.

products.title: Mule Kick Asphalt
products.body_html:
Design

There is a reason why you don't stand behind a mule... They kick... Hence this beauty has the dent to prove it...

Material

100% Western Beaver Fur Felt Hat sustainably acquired

Specifications

100% Beaver fur felt with a subtle dying undertones of blue indigo. A 3 3/4" Teardrop square Crown boxed with a 3" table top flat Brim detailed with red accented hemp cord and double square Knot. Handcrafted in our atelier in NYC. Please allow 2-4 weeks to custom make this special piece.

One of our favorite Master piece this season created by our MadHatter Orlando Palacios. Mashed Tear Drop Crown with a Rear Mule Kick, distressed Cognac Band with a reverse 3 tip bow.

products.title: MONTECRISTI PATRON
products.body_html:
Design

Our Montecristi Leo Carillo combines a low crown with a wearable brim (between 2 1/4 and 2 5/8"). This is a custom Hand Painted Montecristi. Rarer than a perfect diamond and infinitely more refined, we are proud to carry the most exquisitely crafted Montecristi Panama hats in the world. Depending on the quality of the weave, a Worth & Worth Montecristi Panama Hat can take several months to weave by our master weavers in Ecuador. Available in four different qualities, the result is a hat with soft texture, translucent appearance and luminous ivory color.

Material

Custom Hand painted Montecristi. Montecristi Panama straw handwoven in Ecuador available in 4 different qualities: Artisan, Master, Museum and Superfino

Specifications

Our Montecristi Leo Carillo combines a low crown with a wearable brim (between 2 1/4 and 2 5/8"). This is a custom Hand Painted Montecristi. Trimmed with a blue over dye hemp cord band and finished off with handsome boating knot. Handwoven by our master weavers in Ecuador Hand Painted and Handcrafted in our atelier in NYC. Truly a work of art.

products.title: Montecristi Optimo
products.body_html:
Design

With its Original English Roll-Up Shape our Montecristi optimo combines a 4 ¼” crown and a 2 ½” brim. Rarer than a perfect diamond and infinitely more refined, we are proud to carry the most exquisitely crafted Montecristi Panama hats in the world. Depending on the quality of the weave, a Worth & Worth Montecristi Panama Hat can take several months to weave by our master weavers in Ecuador. Available in four different qualities, the result is a hat with soft texture, translucent appearance and luminous ivory color.

Specifications

With its Original English Roll-Up Shape our Montecristi optimo combines a 4 ¼” crown and a 2 ½” brim. Handwoven by our master weavers in Ecuador Handcrafted in our atelier in NYC. Truly a work of art.

products.title: Montecristi Hand Dyed Dark Grey
products.body_html:
Design

This Montecristi is a Dark Grey Hand Dyed with black overtones and a 1 1/2" Asphalto Hat band. Rarer than a perfect diamond and infinitely more refined, we are proud to carry the most exquisitely crafted Montecristi Panama hats in the world. Depending on the quality of the weave, a Worth & Worth Montecristi Panama Hat can take several months to weave by our master weavers in Ecuador. Available in four different qualities, the result is a hat with soft texture, translucent appearance and luminous ivory color.

Material

Montecristi Panama straw handwoven in Ecuador, hand dyed, available in 4 different qualities: Artisan, Master, Museum and Superfino Our woven straws are hand dyed in our atelier in NYC by using plants or vegetables base pigments. Vegetable dying minimizes the harmful effects on the surrounding environment.

Specifications

This Montecristi is a Dark Grey Hand Dyed with black overtones and a 1 1/2" Asphalto Hat band. This master piece combines a 4" semi-teardrop crown with a wearable 3" brim. The brim can varies from 2 1/8" to 3" brim with an average of 3".
Handwoven by our master weavers in Ecuador Handcrafted in our atelier in NYC. Truly a work of art.
Please feel free to contact us if you would like a specific size brim or crown shape. As it is a custom order, we can design your summer hat to fit your particular needs.

products.body_html:
Design

Vegetable dying minimizes the harmful effects on the surrounding environment.

Specifications

This Montecristi is a Coco Brown Hand Dyed with warm grey overtones and a 1 1/4" Coffee Brown band. This master piece combines a 4" C-Crown with a wearable 2 3/4" brim. The brim can varies from 2 1/8" to 2 3/4" brim with an average of 2 3/4".
Handwoven by our master weavers in Ecuador Handcrafted in our atelier in NYC. Truly a work of art.
Please feel free to contact us if you would like a specific size brim or crown shape. As it is a custom order, we can design your summer hat to fit your particular needs.

products.title: Montecristi Tripple Dyed
products.body_html:
Design

Hand dyed with a unique Indigo Washed color, this Montecristi Bucket Hat is a Montecristi SuperFino. Rarer than a perfect diamond and infinitely more refined, we are proud to carry the most exquisitely crafted Montecristi Panama hats in the world. Depending on the quality of the weave, a Worth & Worth Montecristi Panama Hat can take several months to weave by our master weavers in Ecuador. Available in four different qualities, the result is a hat with soft texture, translucent appearance and luminous ivory color.

Material

This Montecristi Bucket Hat is a Montecristi SuperFino. The Superfino quality is the highest quality weave. The Superfino are the lightest of all and the consistency of the weave, the “remate” (back weave) becomes almost invisible to the eye. Hold it to the light and it glows, seemingly translucent.

Specifications

Montecristi Hand dyed Superfino. 4" semi flat crown and 2 3/4" brim. All our hats are exquisitely handmade, therefore they are unique and not identical . Please allow a variation in the color combination. Handwoven by our master weavers in Ecuador Hand dyed and Handcrafted in our atelier in NYC. Truly a work of art.

products.title: Montecristi Capri
products.body_html:
Design

Chic and easy going, lose your stress underneath this feel good montecristi handwoven straw. Rarer than a perfect diamond and infinitely more refined, we are proud to carry the most exquisitely crafted Montecristi Panama hats in the world. Depending on the quality of the weave, a Worth & Worth Montecristi Panama Hat can take several months to weave by our master weavers in Ecuador. Material

Montecristi Panama straw handwoven in Ecuador available in 4 different qualities: Artisan, Master, Museum and Superfino

Specifications

With a wrapped indigo itajime hand dyed cotton band, wear it with a pair of Jean or a linen suit, to work or to the beach 4" crown and choose you brim size (a short 2 1/2 " brim in this picture, please mention your preferred brim size in the comments when you launch the order) Handwoven by our master weavers in Ecuador Handcrafted in our atelier in NYC. Truly a work of art.

products.title: Montage Ombre
products.body_html:
Design

Supple to the touch. A hat subtle enough that just by touching it, the felt molds into any shape you desire. We utilize an "Ombre" treatment to re-dye the felt to drop complimentary overtones on this special felt piece.

Material

100% Hare Fur Felt sustainably acquired and hand dyed. Our custom hats are hand dyed by using plants and vegetables base pigments.

Specifications

A modest 2 1/4'' brim with a tapered round crown with an "ombre" treatment Handmade in our atelier in NYC. All our hats are exquisitely handmade, therefore they are unique and not identical. Even though we have the most attentive artisans who are the “Masters” of their craft, there may be natural variances in our products, especially custom dyed hats. Please allow 2-4 weeks to custom make this special piece.

products.title: MOAB
products.body_html:
Design

This 100% beaver beauty with 3 1/2" brim 4" wide teardrop crown. Dressed with a dusty rose woven linen band and hemp cord. Revisit the rose colored rocks and champagne sand mesas with this new friend

Specifications

3 1/2" brim 4" wide teardrop crown. Dressed with a dusty rose woven linen band and hemp cord. Handmade in our atelier in NYC. Please allow 2-4 weeks to custom make this special piece.

products.title: Milan
products.body_html:
Design

The brim binding of the Milan offers a sharp and finished look for an educated style. A modern classic

Material

100% Merino Wool Felt

Specifications

It sports a moderate 2 1/4” brim binding with an overwelt and a 4" crown. The modest 1 1/2” grosgrain hatband adds a fashionable touch to this modern classic. Handmade in our atelier in NYC.
